text: Agdistis varii is a moth in the family Pterophoridae. It is known from South Africa (Mpumalanga, Limpopo) and Zimbabwe.New Species and Records of Plume Moths of the Genus Agdistis Hübner, 1825 (Lepidoptera: Pterophoridae, Agdistinae) from Southern Africa The wingspan is 16–20 mm. The forewings are grey with two dark dots, one in discal area and another at the costal margin. The hindwings are grey without markings. Adults are on wing from February to May. ==Etymology== The species is named after Dr L. Vari, head of the Lepidoptera Department, Transvaal Museum (Pretoria). ==References== Category:Agdistinae Category:Moths of Africa Category:Moths described in 2009
title: Agdistis varii
